Toby, your shedding waves suggest your follicles are still under telogen stress from ongoing illness + medication load. Right now you’re hovering between peak and stabilization, and the most powerful lever you can pull is a rock-steady sleep rhythm. Consistent timing steadies cortisol, which keeps stress from re‑triggering new waves and signals your body it’s safe to move toward regrowth 🌙.

What to do

  • Pick one target bedtime and stick within 30 min every night (yes, weekends).
  • Lock in a fixed wake time anchored by morning light exposure.
  • Keep your 7h sleep about the same length, but make the *timing* non‑negotiable.
  • If anxiety spikes, still keep the schedule—even short sleep at the same hours trains your clock.

Your recommended schedule

  • Bedtime: aim for 11:00 pm (±30 min max)
  • Wake time: 6:30 am daily
  • Morning anchor: 5–10 min outside light within 30 min of waking

Step-by-step implementation

  1. Choose 11:00 pm as your target “lights out.” Set an alarm 15 min before as a cue.
  2. Wake at 6:30 am every day, even if a tough night—it keeps your rhythm locked.
  3. Get natural light before screens on waking to reinforce your body clock.
  4. Plan meals so last one isn’t crammed at the pillow edge; shift back at least 90 min when you can.
  5. On stressful evenings, hold the schedule steady—consistency matters more than perfection.

Why this works (for you)

  • Your ongoing illness and med changes raise cortisol; regular sleep–wake cuts night spikes that push more hairs into telogen.
  • Because your shedding waves lagged illness onset, steady timing shortens the stabilization window so regrowth can start on schedule.
  • High stress + irregular periods suggest hormonal fragility; rhythm stabilizes progesterone and thyroid tone, giving follicles a calmer environment.
  • Paired with adequate protein/iron, solid sleep tells your body energy can be invested in repair—not just survival.

What to look out for

  • Red flags: Sliding sleep 1–2h later on weekends → undoing your rhythm; if this happens, reset with strict wake times + morning light.
  • Green lights: Easier wake‑ups within 7–10 days; fewer anxious ruminations before bed; hair fall beginning to flatten rather than surge.
  • Remember: you don’t need “perfect sleep”—just consistent times. Your body will do the rest in the background ❤️.
